alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 17 at 9:48AM MST until January 20 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .Potential for an ice jam along the Roaring Fork River may result in a rapid rise in water levels and flow if the jam breaks. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of the Roaring Fork River, between Basalt and Carbondale. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Anglers and anyone near or in the Roaring Fork River should use extreme caution and be on the lookout for ice and debris flowing in the river. Move away from the river and seek higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A thick layer of anchor and surface ice along the Roaring Fork River may result in an ice jam within Snowmass Canyon. Warmer temperatures forecast for the end of the week increase the potential for an ice jam release, which would cause a rapid rise in water levels and flow immediately downstream. - Please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more flood safety information.
info.instruction: Emergency management and law enforcement are asking all citizens to use extreme caution in and around the Roaring Fork River.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys
